title.narrative: OUTPUT 4.2 NATIONAL M&E SYSTEMS

description.narrative: 4.2 Government M&E and information management system progressively generate and use evidence to address the situation of children in Sri Lanka, which contributes to Cross-Sectoral - Monitoring, Data And Situation Analyses, Cross-Sectoral Monitoring, Data And Situation Analyses, Evaluation, Evaluation And Research, Reducing Child Poverty, Research, Safe And Equitable Water, Sanitation And Hygiene Services And Practices, Water, Sanitation And Hygiene Systems And Empowerment Of Communities. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Communications, Advocacy And Public Engagement, Data, Research, Evaluation And Knowledge Management, Evaluations, Research And Data, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, Systems Strengthening To Leave No One Behind. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2022, children and adolescents in Sri Lanka, including the most deprived, have their human rights protected and benefit from effective child-sensitive social protection system.

participating-org.narrative: DEPARTMENT OF PROJECT MANAGEMENT AND MONITORING
THE OXFORD POVERTY AND HUMAN DEVELO OPHI

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: 4.2 Government M&E and information management system progressively generate and use evidence to address the situation of childrenin Sri Lanka

description.narrative: With UNICEF support, the Department of Census and Statistics measured and reported, for the first time ever, on child multidimensional poverty, as well as national multidimensional poverty, marking a critical step towards eradicating poverty in all its forms in the country. Further, the child-friendly cities initiative proved to be a powerful platform for adolescent participation in local decision-making processes. | Status:Partially met | As-of Date:01/02/2022

title.narrative: National evaluation policy approved and respective action plan in place and operational(52795), Text

baseline.value: National Evaluation Policy not in place

target.value: 2022:National Evaluation policy in place and action plan implemented

actual.value: 2021:National evaluation policy is in place but not fully operationalised. UNICEF is supporting targeted actions related to capacity building in-line with the policy.

title.narrative: National government measurement of child poverty using multidimensional index(52796), Text

target.value: 2022:Upcoming HIES includes indicators necessary for measuring child poverty

actual.value: 2021:National and Child MPIs calculated and reported by DCS during HIES 2019 Dissemination Workshop; monetary poverty is in the process of being published.
